entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 03 at 12:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Steady rises on area streams and rivers will continue into the weekend. Showers and thunderstorms on Thursday, along with periods of moderate to heavy rain on Friday, will result in additional opportunities for stream and river rises. Temperatures will be cooling by Saturday, which will slow snow melt, resulting in creek levels beginning a decline into next week.

Waterways will be extremely dangerous, running high, fast, and cold, increasing

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Along the Bear River, to the south of Cokeville. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 02 at 2:56PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warm Temperatures this Week Increase Snow Melt and the Potential for Flooding... Warm temperatures are expected through Wednesday, which will continue to melt low elevation and foothill snow across far western Wyoming. High temperatures in the valleys will range from 55 to 65 each afternoon with a few readings into the 70s.
